description: Application for a replacement planning permission to extend the time limit for implementation of planning permission PP/2009/1625 dated 28/07/2009 for: construction of a second floor / roof extension; two storey rear extension from first and second floor level; associated with the conversion of the upper floors (first and second floors) from offices (Use Class B1) to five self-contained units (Use Class C3) comprising 2 x studio, 2 x 1 bedroomed and 1 x 2 bedroomed; and external alterations
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: P659/101 (Existing Ground/First Floor Plan), P659/102 (Existing Front and Rear Elevations), P659/103 (Existing Section A-A), ASK659001,003 & 004 (Photographs and Computer Images), P659/201 (Proposed First and Second Floor Plan), P659/202 (Proposed Second Floor & Roof Plan), P659/203 (Proposed Sections A-A & B-B),  P659/204 (Proposed Sections C-C & D-D),  P659/205 (Proposed Front and Rear Elevations),  P659/206 (Proposed Side Elevations), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'New Plan for the Environment', The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4-7.6 of The London Plan (2011). | Details of refuse storage bins and enclosures including screening and a recycling and refuse management plan in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area.in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 (Refuse Storage), The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4-7.6 of The London Plan (2011). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The approved details shall be implemented in this development prior to the first occupation of any of the residential flats hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 (Accessible Ealing), The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policy 7.2 of The London Plan (2011). | Details of sound attenuation measures from external noise together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential flats shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration), The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011). | Details of sound attenuation measures for the insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the residential flats shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration), The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011). | Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied the developer shall enter into a section 106 agreement with the local planning authority to ensure that any future residents of the 5 flats within the development to form 5 self-contained flats at 70a Broadway, West Ealing shall not be eligible to obtain residents' parking permits to park their vehicles in the CPZ.  Reason: In the interests of traffic safety, and to ensure that the surrounding streets are not subject to parking stress or danger or nuisance from inappropriate on-street parking or waiting as a result of the proposed development in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8  adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Document 3 Low Car Housing in Controlled Parking Zones), The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 6.3, 6.5, 6.9, 6.11, 6.13 & 6.14 of The London Plan (2011). | Details of security measures in compliance with the secured by design standards shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authorityt. The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.   Reason: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements in accordance with policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan For The Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 8 (Safer Ealing), The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2011) | All windows facing directly onto the internal refuse store and lightwell shall be non opening and shall be fitted and permanently maintained with obscure glass as detailed on the submitted and approved plans.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and in the interests of crime prevention in accordance with policies 4.4 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). 10.	No part of the roof of the development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties and future residents of the development in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4-7.6 of The London Plan (2011). | The cycle parking shown on the approved plan shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004), The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 6.3, 6.5, 6.9, 6.11, 6.13 & 6.14 of The London Plan (2011).
